abstract: The position at Providence, which Dick Parsons plans to pursue part time, will put him back into the deal-making fray in the media world.
snippet: The position at Providence, which Dick Parsons plans to pursue part time, will put him back into the deal-making fray in the media world.
lead_paragraph: Richard D. Parsons, chairman of Citigroup and former chief executive of Time Warner, is planning to announce on Wednesday that he will become a senior adviser to Providence Equity Partners, the large private equity firm that owns media companies like Metro Goldwyn Mayer, Hulu and Univision, according to people briefed on the appointment.

headline.main: Citi’s Parsons Said to Join Equity Firm
headline.print_headline: Parsons of Citigroup Is Said to Take Role in Equity Firm
